author: Matt 6418

text:
Thanks for making me realize that the OST of Lone Survivor was not included in the Humble Indie Bundle... :(

I didn't enjoy the game itself a lot, too much backtracking simply of because the chosen design. I would find myself in situation where hords of monsters were blocking the way. In a 3D survival horror you could (mostly) outrun them when you are low on ammo, in a 2D game this was impossible many times. So it was: kill a few monsters, return home, kill a few monsters...

author: Halogen59

text: Lone Survivor and its soundtrack are made by Jasper Byrne, who also composed some tracks for Hotline Miami. He's clearly a big Silent Hill fan, especially SH2, just like myself. This is basically Silent Hill 2D: rusty visuals, clunky combat, radio noise when approaching﻿ enemies, the music style, the storytelling, etc. It doesn't try to hide its roots either with some references to Pyramid Head, mirrors and holes. Very enjoyable for﻿ someone who misses the classic SH games made by Team Silent.
author: SupraDarky

text: I﻿ decided about 2 hours ago I'd just post my 10 favorite games of the year by mixing it with the list. There are two small problems though: 1. I can see myself having a hard time finding even one good enough track from a couple games in my Top 10, and 2. some of the games have already been represented very recently in the list. It's okay though, it's just once a year and it's fun. One thing to note, I haven't played a LOT of the awesome 2012 games (Xenoblade, XCOM, most Nintendo games).
author: SupraDarky
